title: Taylor Swift says one question has the potential to 'deteriorate her mental health'
text:

Taylor Swift says one particular question asked by interviews causes her inner turmoil that "deteriorates her mental health".

The singer, 30, was performing at her intimate Tiny Desk Concert in the US, where she chatted to fans.

She is known for her heartbreak tunes about her failed romances, but Taylor revealed she is often asked what she would write about if she became happy.

"I've gotten a question over and over again that I think, like has the potential to, like, seriously deteriorate my mental health", she said.

(Image: npr Music)

"The question is 'What will you ever do if you get happy?'"

Her audience laughed as she added: "'Like what will you write about? Will you just never be able to write a song again?'"

"It's an interesting question", she mused.

(Image: npr Music)

Taylor explained to the audience that when she wrote songs as a child, she took inspiration from films and books to write about heartbreak.

But once she reached her teens, her flings with high profile men such as John Mayor, Joe Jonas, Tom Hiddleston and Harry Styles coloured her music.

The star said she did worry that once her love life settled down, she would no longer write number one hits.

(Image: SPLASH)

(Image: FameFlynet)

"I'd go home and be like, 'What would happen if I were ever happy?' Would I not be able to do the thing I love the most in the world?'" she said.

"Would I not be able to write breakup songs anymore?' I love writing breakup songs. They're so fun to write!"

But her fears were unfounded as she has now found long-term love with boyfriend Joe Alwyn, and her loved up latest album Lover has remained top of the album charts.

The couple have been in a relationship for three years, but keep it private.

(Image: Hewitt / SplashNews.com)

(Image: Empics Entertainment)

Actor Joe is English, and Taylor's escapades with him in London inspired her track London Boy, which includes lyrics such as: "They say home is where the heart is, but that's not where mine is."

People are also obsessed with her inclusion of British words and phrases like "I fancy you", "high tea" and "uni" and at one point, she even attempts a cockney accent saying: "Babes, don't threaten me with a good time".

The chorus lists a number of places across the capital that her beau has taken her on dates, including Camden Market, Soho, the West End, Brixton, Shoreditch and to Highgate, where they went to "meet all of his best mates".
description: Taylor has dealt with a lot of heartbreak which informed her music for years, but this has become a worry for the songstress
